info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 02 at 2:19PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...ANOTHER STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTHWESTERN SAN MIGUEL COUNTY THROUGH 245 PM MDT... At 217 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking another strong thunderstorm over Romeroville, or near Las Vegas, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Las Vegas, Storrie Lake State Park, Romeroville, Tecolote, and Ojitos Frios. This includes the following highways... Interstate 25 between Mile Markers 334 and 359. State Road 104 between Mile Markers 1 and 12. State Road 65 between Mile Markers 1 and 3. State Road 283 between Mile Markers 1 and 5. State Road 518 between Mile Markers 1 and 5. The previous thunderstorm that moved through Las Vegas in the past hour produced hail up to 3 inches deep. This second storm will add to those accumulations making travel hazardous on I-25 in the Las Vegas area. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: Accumulations of hail on roads can create very slick and hazardous driving conditions. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM MDT for northeastern New Mexico.
